intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis cylindrica, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces delicate, white or pale pink flowers. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often found in cloud forests and is considered a rare and specialized species.
